result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Jerome Lewis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 AND 2 dismissed and read in to 15CF79 for sentencing purposes.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26. Court preapproves transfer to branch 26 for global resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Carter's Retail Store at 11500 W Burleight Street, Suite 164, Wauwatosa, WI

Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
